required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Safety and Effectiveness of Propagermanium in Diabetic Kidney Disease Participants Receiving Irbesartan
clinical_study.official_title: A Phase 2, Double-Blind, Randomized, Placebo-Controlled, Crossover Study Evaluating the Safety and Efficacy of Propagermanium in Patients With Diabetic Kidney Disease (DKD) Who Are Receiving Irbesartan

brief_summary.textblock:
This study will be evaluating the safety and efficacy of propagermanium for the treatment of participants with DKD who are already taking irbesartan by:
- monitoring symptoms that participants may experience while on the study,
- measuring levels of protein in participant's urine and kidney function during the course of the study,
- measuring the levels of propagermanium and irbesartan that enters into participant's urine and blood, and
- comparing the propagermanium outcomes to participants' pre-study and placebo outcomes.
Eligible participants will randomly be assigned to one of two arms to receive both the propagermanium and placebo in different orders as follows, either:
Treatment Period 1 taking a propagermanium capsule twice a day for 12 weeks, followed by a six week washout period followed by Treatment Period 2 taking a placebo capsule twice a day for 12 weeks.
OR Treatment Period 1 taking a placebo capsule twice a day for 12 weeks, followed by a six week washout period followed by Treatment Period 2 taking a propagermanium capsule twice a day for 12 weeks.

study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)

primary_outcome.measure: The Change in Albumin/Creatinine Ratio with Adjunct use of Propagermanium Compared to Placebo in Participants with DKD who are Receiving Irbesartan

secondary_outcome.measure: The Effect of Treatment with Propagermanium Compared to Placebo on Measures of Estimated Glomerular Filtration Rate
secondary_outcome.description: Assessed by measuring estimated glomerular filtration rate.

secondary_outcome.measure: The Number of Adverse Events with the Adjunct use of Propagermanium
secondary_outcome.description: Adverse events will be recorded by a patient diary and by site staff during site visits.

secondary_outcome.measure: The Effect of Treatment with Propagermanium on Measures of Proteinuria as measured by ACR
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Eleven 24-hour urine samples at week -2, week -1, week 6, week 11, week 12.
secondary_outcome.description: Assessed by measuring albumin/creatinine ratio at each end point.

arm_group.description: Propagermanium one capsule orally twice daily for 12 weeks. Compliance will be measured by drug accountability and completion of a participant diary. Participants will receive 12 weeks propagermanium and 12 weeks placebo separated by a 6 week washout period.

Propagermanium one capsule orally twice daily for 12 weeks. Compliance will be measured by drug accountability and completion of a participant diary. Participants will receive 12 weeks placebo and 12 weeks propagermanium separated by a 6 week washout period.
